I-84 East from Boise, Idaho and Oregon
I-84 west from Twin falls, Idaho
Highway 20 coming down from the north near Sun Valley
Highway 51 Coming from Elko, Nevada
Highway 67 coming from Mountain Home AFB and Grandview, Idaho

Boise Airport is approx. a 45 minute from Mountain Home.

Play: Desert Canyon Golf Course: 
Very inexpensive course to play and never packed. Come on a weekday and have the course to yourself. Course has no sand bunkers and very little obstacles which makes it fun for the beginner golfer. Front nine is first time player friendly, but the back nine has a few holes in which you must tee off over a canyon. 
Course fee= $18.
Golf Carts= Yes 
Bar= Yes 
Rentals=Yes

Mountain Home Supercross Track: 
Open June through September for practice and Races. $20 practice fee. Short but sweet track. Has a few table tops that are roughly 40-50 feet in length and a medium sized double in the middle of the track with a 30-40 foot clearance. An average rider can master this track within a few laps. Definitely worth it for its proximity to the city of mountain home.

': 
Follow Air Base road and turn right onto elmcrest street at the intersection by the chevron. Follow that road to the "T" intersection and take a left. the track will be on your right. There is also a BMX track next to it and they do some mud racing there. 
(For a cheaper ride follow Highway 67 toward grandview, If you hit the air base you missed the turn towards Grandview which you should have taken. Anyways, on 67 toward grandview you will see an open gate leading to a field full of trails and small rolling hills. Riding there is free.)
